title: Cher dazzles onstage with sexy Centurions at Stockholm gig of THIRD farewell tour
text:
She began her first farewell tour in 2002.

But Cher is taking a new show on the road these days and pulled out the stops at the Friends Arena in Stockholm on Wednesday.

The 73-year-old, who shot to fame alongside Sonny Bono in the 1960s, filled the stage with the extravagant razzle-dazzle her fans have come to expect.

Remember when: Cher is still taking her show on the road 17 years after beginning her first farewell tour and pulled out the stops at the Friends Arena in Stockholm on Wednesday

Her outfits included a Grecian-inspired sparkling blue gown, which she wore while onstage with backup dancers dressed as sexy Centurions.

As the concert wore on, the pop icon tore her gown off to reveal dazzling blue corsetry that was designed to resemble armor.

Her current tour is called Here We Go Again and is a companion piece to Dancing Queen, her smash hit 2018 ABBA cover album of the same name.

She dropped the album two months after the release of her ABBA jukebox movie musical Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again.

Fan service: The 73-year-old, who shot to fame alongside Sonny Bono in the 1960s, filled the stage with the extravagant razzle-dazzle her fans have come to expect

Sizzler: Her outfits included a Grecian-inspired sparkling blue gown, which she wore while onstage with backup dancers dressed as sexy Centurions

In a recent interview promoting her latest concerts to The Sun, Cher dished: 'This is my last tour. I’m 73. I skip across the stage then once I get around it I walk.'

She shared: said: 'My mum is 93 and she keeps going: "Cher, age is just a number. If you don’t bother it, it won’t bother you." I keep going: "Mum you are crazy."'

The California-born singer confessed: 'It is so embarrassing because I keep on having these farewell tours. I’m not 100, but I’m close.'

Cher, who once shared a manager with late comic Joan Rivers, dished: 'I, honest to God, think this is the end, not because I can’t do it any more, but because I’m older than glass and people are just going to get tired of coming to see me.'

Smashing: As the concert wore on, the pop icon tore her gown off to reveal dazzling blue corsetry that was designed to resemble armor

Backdrop: Her current tour is called Here We Go Again and is a companion piece to Dancing Queen, her smash hit 2018 ABBA cover album of the same name

Her first farewell tour was called Living Proof and spanned a whopping 326 performances in North America, Europe, Australia and New Zealand.

The tour lasted from 2002 to 2005 - and three years after it ended, she began a Las Vegas residency that lasted until 2011.

By 2014, she was back on the road with another farewell tour called Dressed To Kill, performing 49 shows of the first leg in the United States and Canada.

However, before she could embark on the 30-show second leg, she came down with a viral infection and had to cancel all the rest of her tour dates.

Still busy: She dropped the album two months after the release of her ABBA jukebox movie musical Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again

'I skip across the stage then once I get around it I walk': In a recent interview promoting her latest concerts to The Sun , Cher dished: 'This is my last tour'

'I am totally devastated. Nothing like this has ever happened to me. I cannot apologize enough to all the fans who bought tickets,' Cher wrote on her website.

'I’m so proud of this show. It is my best ever. I sincerely hope that we can come back again next year and finish what we started.'

The show never did come back, and Here We Go Again is the first time Cher has gone on a full-on tour since Dressed To Kill.

However, in 2017 she did begin a residency that takes her between Las Vegas, Atlantic City and Oxon Hills and will end next February.

History: Her first farewell tour was called Living Proof and spanned a whopping 326 performances in North America, Europe, Australia and New Zealand
description: She began her first farewell tour in 2002. But Cher is still taking her show on the road 17 years later and pulled out the stops at the Friends Arena in Stockholm on Wednesday.
